work.name: Wrocław University of Science and Technology
highlights: Conducted a Cloud Programming lab course focused on AWS services and Infrastructure as Code workflows with Terraform.

work.name: Cat-astrophe Games
highlights: Built Unity tooling to validate asset configuration and streamline persistence workflows for a published game.

education.institution: Wrocław University of Science and Technology
education.area: Applied Computer Science — Information Systems Design
education.summary: Graduated with distinction. Four-time recipient of the first-category Rector's Scholarship for outstanding academic performance (99th percentile).

education.institution: Wrocław University of Science and Technology
education.summary: Graduated with distinction. Two-time recipient of the first-category Rector's Scholarship for outstanding academic performance (99th percentile).

highlights: Developed Unity simulations for underwater drones; integrated with ML-Agents and ROS2.
Led and managed a subteam tasked with creating interactive demos and minigames.
Co-conducted a workshop during XXVII Lower Silesian Science Festival on AUV development.
Set up and maintained internal services: identity/SSO, knowledge base, Git; automated member data sync workflows.

projects.name: Human motion analysis planning methodology
projects.description: Master’s thesis component: method for selecting sensing strategy, sensors, and data-processing pipelines.
highlights: Represented domain knowledge as a weighted directed multigraph and designed an algorithm for optimal strategy selection based on user-defined constraints and criteria.
Verified the method on a real-world scenario of monitoring Wing Chun martial arts training.

projects.name: Remote Control IoT System
highlights: Developed and iterated on a horizontally scalable IoT system across monolithic and microservice architectures.
Increased throughput from 8 to 12000 commands per second by migrating from a relational DB and Django backend to an actor-based architecture with .NET Orleans.
Integrated with AWS IoT Core and SQS; deployed iterations on AWS ECS.

projects.name: AI Voice Journal
highlights: Led a 3-person team building a voice-only, dialogue-based journal with speaker identification, LLM integration, vector search, and retrieval-augmented generation.

publications.name: Simulation Environment for Underwater Vehicles Testing and Training in Unity3D
publications.summary: Conference chapter (pp. 844–853) describing a Unity3D-based simulation environment for testing and training underwater vehicles.
